data.text: 002376150141 SERVICE LEVEL AGREEMENT NO. 01 TO MASTER SERVICES AGREEMENT This Service Level Agreement Number: 01 ("SLA") is made on this 29th day of November 2021; ("Execution Date") entered into by and between: FIS Payment Solutions & Services India Private Limited, a Company incorporated under the Companies Act, 1956, having its registered office address at S-405(LGF), Greater Kailash Part II, New Delhi-110048 and its Corporate office at 3rd floor, Fairmont, Hiranandani Business Park, Powai, Mumbai 400 076 (hereinafter referred as "FIS" or "Customer" which expression shall unless repugnant to the context of meaning thereof, be deemed to mean and include its permitted assigns and successors); And CtrlS Datacenters Limited, a Company incorporated under the Companies Act, 1956, having its registered office address at Pioneer Tower, Plot No.16, Software Units Layout, Madhapur, Hyderabad (hereinafter referred as "Service Provider" or "CtrlS", which expression shall unless repugnant to the context of meaning thereof, be deemed to mean and include its permitted assigns and successors). 'FIS' and 'Service Provider' shall be individually referred to as "Party" and collectively as "Parties". WHEREAS: A. The Parties have entered into a Master Services Agreement dated 18th November 2021 (the "Master Agreement") B. The terms and conditions of the Master Agreement are incorporated, by reference, into this SLA. C. FIS wishes to avail from the Service Provider certain services like data center hosting, disaster recovery services, mail solution, managed security services and rental service, and the Service Provider is willing to provide such services to FIS in accordance with the terms and conditions as agreed under the Agreement. NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual promises and covenants contained herein the parties agree as follows: 1. DEFINITIONS Terms capitalized and used in this SLA will have the meanings ascribed to them under the Master Agreement, unless otherwise specifically provided for in this SLA. In the event of a conflict, ambiguity or contradiction between this SLA and any other part of the Master Agreement, the terms of this SLA shall take precedence. For the purpose of this SLA, the following terms shall have the meaning as follows: (i) "Agreement" shall mean the Master Agreement and this SLA collectively. CTRL & FIS Confidential Information (ii) "Assets" shall mean assets including all infrastructure that are provided exclusively to FIS which are not: (i) included as a part of shared service; and (ii) which has not reached its end of life in accordance with applicable laws. (iii) A "Change in Control" of Service Provider is any event or series of events by which (i) any person, entity or group of persons or entities acquires control of Service Provider, where "control" is possession, directly or indirectly, of the power to direct or cause the direction of the management and policies of Service Provider, whether through record or beneficial ownership of voting securities, by contract or otherwise, or (ii) if Service Provider is a corporation, limited liability company or other entity having a board of directors or other group of individuals having similar functions, during any period of twelve (12) consecutive months commencing before or after the date hereof, individuals who at the beginning of such twelve-month period were members of Service Provider's board of directors or other such group cease for any reason to constitute a majority of the members. (iv) "Deliverables" shall mean all infrastructure that shall be provided by CtrlS as stated in Section 3 (FIS & CtrlS Responsibilities) of this SLA. (v) "FIS Client(s)" shall mean FIS's customer named as per the 'List of FIS Clients' provided to CtrlS, by FIS, pursuant to Section 12 of this SLA. (vi) A "Service Provider Product" is a Service or software of any kind and in any form provided by Service Provider, or a Service Provider Affiliate, to FIS, or an FIS Affiliate under this SLA for use by FIS or for the benefit of FIS, by a third party on behalf of FIS, and/or for use by FIS Client(s) or for the benefit of FIS Client(s), in connection with FIS' or FIS Client's internal business purposes, as a FIS service, or as part of a FIS service. (vii) "Tenant" shall mean a single virtual entity created for an FIS Client. (viii) "User License" shall mean the unique user IDs issued to each FIS Client(s) 2. SERVICES 2.1. Service Provider shall perform certain services under this SLA, including but not limited to data center & disaster recovery hosting services, managed security services, rental services, etc., as agreed under this SLA including as more specifically described in detail under Annexure- A (Statement of Work) annexed to this SLA ("Services"), during the Term of this SLA. CtrlS acknowledges that the Services that FIS is procuring under this SLA are very critical to the business of FIS and affairs of its clients. Hence, CtrlS acknowledges and agrees that it will take every effort to ensure that the Services are provided without interruption or degradation below the service levels agreed under Section 11 of this SLA and that it shall not in any way limit the provision of any, or all of the Services during the Term of this SLA, including any extensions thereto. 2.2. CtrlS agrees that it shall maintain 20% buffer capacity for Services across all environments and platforms at any given point in time during the term of this SLA, which shall be reviewed by FIS on a quarterly basis. In the event, CtrlS does not meet this 20% buffer capacity in any quarter, FIS shall charge a penalty @0.5% of the Monthly Recurring Fee payable by FIS as per Section 7 in the immediate succeeding month of the defaulting quarter. CtrlS shall provide monthly reports to FIS where CtrlS can establish that this 20% buffer capacity is met. 2.3. Unless otherwise stated elsewhere in this SLA, CtrlS agrees that CtrlS shall continue to deliver Services with end-to-end responsibility in accordance with the applicable RBI guidelines during the term of this SLA, with no additional cost to FIS. Ctr/sg CTRL & FIS Confidential Information 2.4. CtrlS shall ensure that the Data Center and Disaster Recovery Site maintained pursuant to this SLA shall be PCI-DSS certified and are ISO 27001 and ISO 22301 certified and CtrlS will furnish the copy of these certifications on an annual basis during the Term of this SLA. 2.5. Additional Enhancements: The Parties agree that upon request by FIS for enhancement in Services, CtrlS shall deliver such enhancements within 8 weeks from the date of issue of Purchase Order to CtrlS by FIS. In case of delay of more than 8 weeks in this regard, FIS shall have the right to charge a penalty@ 0.5% of the value of Purchase Order issued. 2.6. CtrlS has provided summary of the transition of roles and responsibilities from CtrlS to FIS as applicable to the Services during the Term of this SLA and the Parties has agreed upon a detailed project plan for such transition. 2.7. CtrlS Affiliate: FIS and CtrlS acknowledges and agrees that Services under this SLA may be provided by CtrlS or its Affiliate - Cloud4C Services Pvt Ltd ("Cloud4C") as mentioned under this SLA and CtrlS shall remain solely responsible and liable for the work performed by its Affiliates or their representatives. 3. FIS & CTRLS RESPONSIBILITIES: FIS shall have the following responsibilities under this SLA, in addition to other responsibilities specified elsewhere in this SLA: a. estimation of traffic. b. sizing of the hardware. Note: The indicative bill of material given under Clause 4.1 of Annexure A (Statement of Work) to this SLA, is as per the sizing by FIS. c. all application software and database licenses unless mentioned in Inclusion List (Section 8 of SLA) will be provided by FIS d. All application level issues, and application management & support shall be FIS' responsibility under this SLA. The Parties shall have the following responsibilities and deliverables, which are more particularly detailed in Annexure - B (Responsibility Matrix of the Parties) to this SLA. Architecture diagram attached IBM QRadar SIEM (Security Information and Event Management) provides real-time visibility of FIS IT infrastructure, which FIS can use for threat detection and prioritization. IBM QRadar collects, processes, aggregates, and stores network data in real time. QRadar uses that data to manage network security by providing real-time information and monitoring, alerts and offenses, and responses to network threats Per EPS 2 PIM - Arcos Architecture diagram attached Arcos PIM (Privileged Identity Management) involves managing privileged individual identities, their authentication, authorization, and privileges/permissions within or across systems and enterprise boundaries with the goal of increasing security and productivity while optimizing the downtime, repetitive tasks & the cost. PIM count per user is calculated across DC and DR which includes the total number of devices and users for both FIS and end users Per User 3 ATP - Forti sandbox Architecture diagram attached FortiSandbox is part of Fortinet's breach protection solution that integrates with Fortinet's Security Fabric platform to address the rapidly evolving and more targeted threats including ransomware, crypto-malware, and others across a broad digital attack surface. Specifically, it delivers real-time Dedicated Per Setup per Tenant CTRL & FIS Confidential Information / 14    actionable intelligence through the automation of zero-day advanced malware detection and response.  4 DAM - McAfee Architecture diagram to be attached /McAfee DAM McAfee DAM (Database activity monitoring) is a database security technology for monitoring and analysing database activity that operates independently of the database management system (DBMS) and does not rely on any form of native (DBMS-resident) auditing or native logs such as trace or transaction logs. DAM is typically performed continuously and in real-time. Per DB Instance 5 WAF - F5 This is part of Load Balancer. Architecture will be similarto LB. A web application firewall (WAF) protects web applications from a variety of application layer attacks such as cross-site scripting (XSS), SQL injection, and cookie poisoning, among others. Attacks to appsarethe leading cause of breaches— they are the gateway to your valuable data. With the right WAF in place, you can block the array of attacks that aim to exfiltrate that data by compromising your systems Per WAF Instance DC-OPS RACI COE Services Cloud4c (Build) FIS (Build) Cloud4c (Management) FIS (Management) Capacity review and planning NO YES NO YES FIS will only own capacity planning but Ctrls needs to own capacity management based on agreed threshold of capacity, which is 80%. Hardware deployment for capacity needs to be owned by CtrlS- Hardware deployment will be taken care by CtrlS Infra team. CtrlS Unix team has limited scope however as and when required unix support will be there OBJECTIVE AND SCOPE FOR DC OPERATION TEAM OF CTRLS Objective: A Data Center Operator is in charge of ensuring that all services in Data Center are working smoothly and effectively. Operation team charged with making sure any necessary or scheduled repairs or maintenance are performed as required. DC operation team is responsible for all physical resources in DC and maintaining 100% uptime for servers and other devices. Scope: Data center operations is a broad term that includes all processes and operations performed within a data center. Typically, data center operations are distributed across several categories such as: New implementation, Hardware upgradation and degradation, CMDB, Hardware troubleshooting and diagnostic, preventive maintenance, remote hand support, backup media handling, space provisioning, firmware update, rack and stack, racks doors and locks maintenance, devices physical monitoring, physical resource migration, service request, security request, incident management. CTRL & FIS Confidential Information • DC Operations: Installing, maintaining, monitoring, patching and updating server, storage • and network resources 9 DC Security: Processes, tools and technologies that ensure physical in the data center premises • DC Power and cooling physical monitoring: All processes that ensure enough power is supplied to the data center facility and the cooling system is operational. • Monitor, manage and oversee all infrastructure devices. Maintain, troubleshoot, fix and/or replace all infrastructure devices (24x7x365). • Provide routine and continuous monitoring of Manage and COLO hardware, Provide maintenance and configuration management for all IT infrastructure. • Activation and Deactivation: Respond, coordinate and manage all change requests for additions, removals and modifications to devices. • Coordination with store for replacement devices and part availability. Replacement and faulty parts IN/OUT. Provide and maintain Department's lab for compatibility check and R&D. ® Inter-rack cable management to be performed every 6 months Asset Management Support: Ctrls shall provide asset management support to maintain a complete inventory of hardware, warranty status, device life span, utilities and licenses. Incident Management Process: Process to Support Data Center Incidents such network outages, server down, devices not responding. Problem Management Process: Handling of Identified Problems or Issues within the data center including root cause analysis, comprehensive fixes, improvements, and knowledge library inputs for future problem resolution. Request Fulfillment Process: Approach to handle end user, organization requests for moves, adds, or changes to infrastructure within the data center. Access Management Process: physical access to the data center and its assets for end users. Service Desk Function Provides a support organization with rules and responsibilities for service support to end users. Remote hand support to customer and COE as physical observation and reboot request. Regulate rack-level capacity and space allocation: Servers vary greatly in power draw and utilization, factors that affect how much power each rack consumes. Here's how to estimate the power draw in a rack so you can insert new equipment, plan space for additional servers and arrays or rebalance power loads. Follow security best practices: The best data center operations best practices implementation means nothing if unauthorized personnel or unknown people can access corporate information via the data center. Coordination with vendor: DC operations team can handle hardware problem or other issue that comes up in the data center. Managing and coordination with vendor for devices under warranty and AMC. Operating a data center at peak efficiency and reliability requires the combined efforts of facilities and IT. Coordination with Facilities infrastructure and building management system (BMS): All the supporting systems in a data center face heavy loads and must be properly maintained to continue operating satisfactorily. These systems include cooling, humidification, air handling, power distribution, backup CTRL & FIS Confidential Information power generation and much more. Racks Door and locks Maintenance: In process of DC floor walk DCOPS engineers will observe and notify if any Rack door/locks are not properly locking, Manager/Team lead will coordinate with procurement team to get the quote from vendor and fix the Rack door/look issues. All penalties shall be computed based on the Service level gap described below and under no other parameter. Datacenter Availability SLA and Penalty: CtrlS assures the Customer 99.995 % uptime availability of the Infrastructure viz., Power and Cooling** covered by this SLA. Hardware Uptimes SLA would be 4 hours resolution from the time of detection of hardware problem either by Service Provider help desk or by the Customer. Subject to Clause 3 of this SLA, in the event Service Provider fails to provide the Customer with the Services required by the Customer in accordance with the SLA, such failure resulting from complete unavailability of Service Provider network, such events will be treated as "Qualified Network Downtime Event" for which Service Provider will issue the Customer a Service Credit - calculated as per method provided in Clause 1. ** Service Provider assures Customer that it will provide cooling @ 21°C (+/-) 2°C and Humidity levels @ 50 % (+/-) 5%. 1) The Actual Uptime (A) calculated in the respective month and it will be measured (compared) against the total uptime hours of the year 99.995%. If the outages exceed total uptime hours the following service credits shall be due to Customer: A >= 99.995% No Credits A in between 99.994% to 99.000% 2 days equivalent service credit for the Service period affected calculated on a prorate basis. A in between 98.999% to 98.000% 7 days equivalent service credit for the Service period affected calculated on a prorate basis. A is < 98% 15days equivalent service credit for the Service period affected calculated on a prorate basis Calculation of Actual Uptime % = Total Uptime Hours -Actual Downtime x 100. Total Uptime Hours 2) The Customer is required to provide a preventive maintenance window, once in every quarter to enable Service Provider to update the various patches and carry out other preventive maintenance. The time required to carry out this preventive maintenance by Service Provider shall depend upon the environment of the Customer and shall be informed to the Customer before the time window is sought. During this window, Customer's environment shall not be available and the same shall not be counted as Downtime. 3) For the customized solutions provided by Service Provider, preventive maintenance is absolutely essential, and the SLAs offered by Service Provider are based on the explicit understanding that the Customer will provide opportunity for Service Provider to carry out preventive maintenance from time to time. In case the Customer does not provide, at least once in a quarter, the requisite downtime to 19 CTRL & FIS Confidential Information carry out preventive maintenance activities, even after a request is made by Service Provider, Service Provider shall not be liable to provide any Service Credits or any other compensation in case of Downtime or any other loss to Customer such as data loss, denial of service or virus attacks. 4) Service Provider shall recommend usage of high availability architecture for all critical loads, wherein there is a duplication of critical elements. For instance, this may be two power sources to a rack, or two firewalls in the network. In a high availability set-up, it is clarified that even when one of the elements fail, but the other is still running, then the entire set-up/solution/system/environment is considered to be available and the same shall not be counted as Downtime. EXCEPTIONS TO DOWNTIME The following events do not constitute a Downtime and shall not be eligible to be considered for any Service Credit: 1) Interruption due to scheduled maintenance, alteration, or implementation, where the Service Provider provides at least seven days prior notice and to the Customer and also interruption due to Emergency Maintenance; The usual scheduled maintenance time is the early hours of the morning i.e., between lam to 6am. The usual maintenance time would not be more than two hours. 2) The quarterly maintenance window as described in clause 2.6 above. 3) Hardware failure 4) Failure of the Customer links, internet connectivity or end user software, access circuits, local loop or any network not owned or managed by Service Provider. 5) DNS Issues not in scope and control of Service Provider. 6) Negligence or other conduct of Customer or its authorized persons, including a failure or malfunction resulting from applications or services provided by Customer or its authorized persons; 7) A shut down due to circumstances reasonably believed by Service Provider to be a significant threat to the normal operation of the Services, Service Provider's facility, or access to or integrity of Customer data (e.g., hacker or virus attack); 8) Failure or malfunction of any equipment or services not provided by Service Provider; 9) Any abuse or fraud failure to comply with the Acceptable User Policy on the part of Customer and its authorized persons. 10) Any problems outside the Service Provider Facility Network. 11) Any interruptions, delays or failures caused by Customer or Customer's employees, agents, or subcontractors, such as, the following: i. Any problems related to the attacks on the machine such as hacking, attacks, and exploits. 12) Any specific services not part of Services. 13) Force Majeure Event. Care Executive Typical risks and dependencies faced in Datacenter Transformation & Migration Project: Risk & Dependencies Mitigations Initial capital Cost Implementing a private cloud in the organization will require a significant entry cost to satisfy the needs of virtualization and the management layers that compose the fabric to deploy, operate, and monitor the environment. These costs must be realized in each step of the deployment process from prototyping to production. Overtime these costs will turn to cost benefits as shared resource usage wins over traditional forms of resource allocation on a per application instance basis. Security Designing for a secure environment is always a challenge as new threats continue to emerge on a regular basis. Private clouds mitigate many of these attack surfaces since the entire operation is in-house, however organizational concerns still exist when meeting compliance requirements. Compliance n any IT organization the goals of IT must be met while maintaining conformance to organizational and regulatory compliance requirements Technology Partners Competency of technology partners having the right set of skills, experience tools and delivery engine to drive large transformation projects plays a vital role for the success of projects AIDM- Application to Infrastructure Dependency Matrix Our experience has shown that most of the datacenter project has been delayed as AIDM was not studied and analyzed Continuity of Operations No matter how robust the plan may look on paper but during delivery and execution unforeseen issues and dependencies can stall the project; hence DR and backup needs to factored for high-risk change implementations. We suggest DR to be enabled to undertake any adversity CtrlS shall ensure continuity of business and IT operations for FIS and hence high level critical primary datacenter implementation and migration phase should have a tested Disaster Recovery System in place to address all such eventualities covered in CtrlS Scope 5. SIEM solution should have capability to perform at least following activities: Centralize malware monitoring, incident responses, assessing and reporting operational impacts from end point to perimeter with regard to ensuring activation and standard use, monitoring and reviewing malware activity, and most importantly, responding to issues. (Coverage Includes tracking of virus, malware, spyware, spam, malicious website request, unusual resource activity, as well as detection, quarantine and remediation.). Desirable metrics would include top reported malware threats; Anti  virus trends - prevented, detected, remediated; Spam trends - identified and removed; top malware attacked sources, and by prior vulnerability issues; top unusual traffic to and from sources; top systems with suspicious malware activity; anomalous network activity; anti-virus stop, start, update failures etc subject to the availability / limitations of deployed IBM Q- Radar SIEM System. Consolidate monitoring of access activity from various boundary defences such as firewalls, routers, VPNs and other network resources as well as cross-correlating network flows with other operational data to identify suspicious behaviour and potential security threats. (Coverage Includes, based on the subscription; firewall, NAC, NAT, VPN, routers, proxy systems, wireless access point or WAP, attacks and violations, ports, anomalous request types, denial of service and false positives.). Desirable metrics would include top access failures by source and destinations; top inbound connections to internal sources by system, user, bandwidth and time; unusual DNS access and requests; daily or weekly alerts on top 10 connections from sites of concerns; top unusual peak bandwidth utilization sources and destination; top outbound connections to external sources by system, user, bandwidth and time; configuration changes to firewall, VPN, WAP, Domain; Multiple login failures by Firewall, VPN, Domain; Wireless network access by location, by user, by failed attempts; Excessive VM movement by VM, by guest host etc subject to the availability / limitations of deployed IBM Q-Radar SIEM System Consolidate authentication, authorization and accounting (AAA) mechanisms to control appropriate access to resources. Use SIEM rules, alerts and reports to bring together all AAA - successful logins, subsequent secondary logins and user/system activities to facilitate investigations. Track and resolve the "true identity" behind shared credentials. Monitor failures in addition to successful accesses to monitor and investigate insider threats including privileged users and consultants. (Coverage Includes AAA Servers, VPN/RAS/NAS, Directory Services, privileged and administrative access, excessive failures, terminated account use, service account use, tracking 3rd party and consultant access, and monitoring access administration.). Desirable metrics would include top access failures by source, destination, users; top access destinations by users/groups and anomalous access; access login success and failure (internal) - by user, system, by device class, by time (with details); multiple account logons from different geographic locations; suspicious access attempts or failure followed by success from same source; Privileged user access by access failure, by critical resource, by method, by different location/same time; top privileged user access follow by configuration changes; administrative changes to directory service user and group objects - by admin, by user, by group, by resource criticality; use of trusted and service accounts, by volume, by time of day, by domain; remote access login success and failure (VPN, other) - by user, by device class, by time with details etc. subject to the availability / limitations of deployed IBM Q-Radar SIEM System Develop watch lists to facilitate monitoring processes for Acceptable Use Monitoring (AUP) for critical resources, user roles and specific AUP violation scenarios that align to those policies. (Coverage includes resources and application access and use, web and email use, access rights management, use of encryption, data leakage prevention, network flow analysis, account use and policy enforcement.) subject to the availability / limitations of deployed IBM Q-Radar SIEM System Include Application platform monitoring, resource monitoring, web application defenses and database activity monitoring. Joliet Road Romeoville, 1ll inois 60446 A mendment E ffective Date. 7/1/2019 rmation Services, LLC 601 Riverside Avenue Jacksonville, FL 32204-2946 This is an amendment (“Amendment”) to the S tatement of W ork dated 9/11/2013 for the M assachusetts DPHWIC Electronic Benefits Transfer (EBT) Processor Services (aS amended, SO V ) between Fidelity Information Services, LLC successor in interest to eFunds Corporation (“FIS” or “Contractor”) and Custom Data Processing, Inc. (“CDP” or Subcontractor ). To the extent that the FIS party to the Agreement (including any addenda, schedule, or attachment thereto) is a subsidiary or affiliate, FIS is entering into this A mendment on behalf of such subsidiary or affiliate, and such subsidiary or affiliate has authorized the entering into of this Amendment. Affili ate means with respect to a party, any entity which directly or indirectly, through one or more intermediaries, is controlled by, or is under common control with such pa rty. AMENDMENT DETAIL Section 2 of the SO V is del eted in its entirety and replaced with the following. “2. Effective and Ending Dates 2.1 Term. This SOW is effective as of September 11, 2013 (the “Effective Date”) and shall terminate at 11:59 p.m. on 30 June 2027 (“Termination Date”). All terms of the Agreement not amended by this Amendment remain in full force and effect. All fees will be settled or paid as described in the Agre ement unless otherwise specified in this Amend ment or the pricing A attachment. In the event of a conflict or inconsistency between this mend ment and the Agreement, this Ame ndment controls. C apitalized words not defined in this Amendment shall have the same meaning as in the Agreement. CUSTOM DATA PROCESSING, INC Name: K|j P le Title: C F CK Dat«: 1 Hl9 FIDELITY INFORMATION SERVICES, LLC Signature: N ame: K . Dear Daniel Rea, Further to our earlier discussion, please find attached the Quotation 105497871/2 for the item(s) you requested from Dell. If you wish to proceed with placing an order based on this Quote please follow the HOW TO PLACE AN ORDER instructions. If I can be of any further assistance please do not hesitate to contact me. I look forward to speaking with you again soon. Yours sincerely Sonia Shannon HOW TO PLACE AN ORDER: If you wish to place an order for the items specified in this Quote, Please always reference the Quotation number when you place your order. In order to facilitate accurate and timely delivery and invoicing of the items, please be sure to provide the following details on your purchase order: Your or Purchaser Name: Position: Phone number (including region code): Email: Date of purchase: Your company/organisation order number: Dell Quote number: Total Price from Dell Quote: By placing the order you agree: - That all details on the quotation are correct and up to date and that this order will be processed using only the details in the quotation and your purchase order; - That you are authorized to make this commitment on behalf of Worldpay UK Limited and - To purchase the item(s) as set out in the quotation and on the basis of Dell's Terms and Conditions for the Sale of Products and Services, as set out in part 3 of this Quote. Dell's Terms and Conditions at www.dell.co.uk/partner shall apply to Products & Services purchased for resale. On receipt of your order, please inspect all components of your product(s) and make Dell aware of any discrepancies with this document as soon as possible and in line with Dell's Terms and Conditions. Please address any complaints to UKI Customer Complaints@dell.com. For the avoidance of doubt, to the extent that Dell accepts a purchase order from you: (a) Dell rejects all additional or inconsistent terms that may be contained in any purchase order or other documentation submitted by you in connection with your order; and (b) Dell conditions its acceptance on the application of these terms. 5. Prices, Payment and Taxes A. Prices. Prices for Products and/or Services shall be set out in the Order Confirmation or Service Document. B. Payment. Invoices shall be paid within 30 days of the invoice date in the currency identified on the invoice. You must advise Dell in writing of a material error in the invoice within 14 days of the invoice date. In that event, (i) payment of amounts corrected by Dell shall be due within 30 days of correction, and (ii) all other amounts shall be paid by the invoice due date. C. Taxes. All amounts due under the Agreement are exclusive of VAT. Dell will provide a valid VAT invoice. You are responsible to pay the VAT. 6. Products, Services and Software A. Performance. Dell (or its appropriate Affiliate or subcontractor) shall provide (i) the Hardware in accordance with the Order Confirmation and (ii) the Services in accordance with, and subject to any additional terms, exclusions and limitations set out in, the applicable Service Document. The Infrastructure Products shall be provided in accordance with and subject to additional terms which can be found here: http://i.dell.com/sites/doccontent/legal/terms- conditions/en/Documents/Infrastructure Products Terms UK EN.pdf ("Supplementary Terms for Infrastructure Products") and which are incorporated by reference into this Agreement. B. Title and Risk. Risk in the Hardware passes from Dell to you upon delivery by Dell, or its carrier, to you or your authorized representative, at the location specified in the Order Confirmation. Dell retains ownership of the Products until full payment is received. Risk and title to the Infrastructure Products shall pass to you as set out in the Supplementary Terms for Infrastructure Products. C. Suspension. Dell may suspend all or part of its obligations under this Agreement:- (i) if required to do so under applicable law; (ii) if Dell believes that you are involved in any fraudulent or illegal activities; or (iii) if you are in breach of your payment obligations or other terms set out in this Agreement. D. Software. The terms upon which Dell shall provide the Software to you are set out in the applicable Software Agreement. 7. Your Obligations A. Your Authorisation for Provision of Services. You will ensure that Dell's (or its appropriate Affiliate or subcontractor's) performance of the Services will not affect any third party manufacturer's warranties. You authorise, and will have obtained all necessary permissions or consents to allow Dell to use or access any and all software, hardware, systems and data that you provide to us, or that you request Dell to use, or which may be necessary to perform the Services. B. Co-operation. You will provide all co-operation necessary for Dell (and/or its Affiliates or subcontractors) to perform the Agreement including co  operating with any instructions provided by Dell. C. On-site Obligations. Where Services are provided on-site, you will provide Dell with free, safe and sufficient access to your facilities and environment, including working space, electricity, safety equipment, access to a computer and a local telephone line. D. Data back-up. You are solely responsible for completing regular back-ups of all data, software and programs on your systems, prior to and during the delivery of the Services. Intellectual Property: All right, title, and interest in the intellectual property in the Hardware, and the methods and processes by which the Services are performed belong solely and exclusively to Dell, its suppliers or licensors. Dell grants you a non-exclusive, non-transferable, free of charge right to use the Services solely (i) in the country or countries in which you do business, (ii) for your internal use, and (iii) for you to enjoy the benefit of the Services as stated in this Agreement. B. Confidentiality: Information that is not generally known to the public, whether or not it is described as confidential or which, due to the nature of the information or the circumstances surrounding its disclosure, should reasonably be understood to be confidential ("Confidential Information"), may only be disclosed to the receiving party on a "need-to-know" basis. The receiving party shall keep the Confidential Information confidential and may not disclose it to any third party. The receiving party shall be liable to the disclosing party for disclosures by its personnel or advisors. 9. Quality of Products WARRANTIES A . Dell will provide the Services with reasonable care and skill (the "Services Warranty"). B. Dell will provide the Hardware free from material defects for a period of 12 months from the date of the invoice ("Hardware Warranty"). C. Dell will provide the Dell-branded spare parts free from defects for (i) 90 days from the date of delivery or (ii) for the remainder of the period of the Hardware Warranty if longer. D. Dell will provide the Infrastructure Products in accordance with the warranty, remedy and exclusion provisions set out in the Supplementary Terms for Infrastructure Products. E. Dell will pass to you, to the extent that Dell is permitted to do so, the benefit of any warranty or guarantee given by the manufacturer or supplier of any third party manufactured Hardware or Software. Without prejudice to your rights against Dell, Dell may therefore ask third party Hardware manufacturers and/or third party Software licensors to fulfill their obligations to you under such warranties and guarantees and seek to ensure that such manufacturers and/or licensors do so with reasonable skill and care and within a reasonable period. F. Dell does not warrant that the Software will operate uninterrupted or that it will be free from defects or that it will meet customer's requirements. G. Dell All other warranties and other terms implied by law are, to the fullest extent permitted by law, excluded from the Agreement. NOTIFICATION H. If the Hardware does not comply with the Hardware Warranty, you must notify Dell in writing within 7 days of the date you discovered, or ought to have discovered, the defect. REMEDIES I. Dell shall either repair or replace the Hardware that does not comply with the Hardware Warranty. Dell may use new or reconditioned goods and components in line with industry standards. J. Where Hardware is replaced, you shall return it to Dell or you shall pay Dell the applicable prices for the replacement Hardware which shall be invoiced by Dell. EXCLUSIONS K. Dell shall re-perform those Services which do not comply with the Services Warranty. L. The above warranties do not apply to: (i) damage caused by alteration, repair, adjustment or installation by someone other than Dell; (ii) damage caused due to accident, misuse or abuse; (iii) damage caused due to Dell's compliance with your written instructions; (iv) damage caused due to normal wear and tear; (v) damage caused due to use of parts and components not supplied or intended for use with the Products; or (vi) products, software or services made, created or performed by a party other than Dell; together the "Excluded Events". 10. Indemnification A. Indemnity from Dell. Dell shall indemnify you (a) against any third party claim that the Hardware and/or Services (excluding third party Products and open source software) supplied by Dell infringe or misappropriate that third party's intellectual property rights in the country in which Dell delivers the Hardware and/or Services ("Indemnified Claims") and (b) by paying: (i) the resulting costs and damages finally awarded against you by a court of competent jurisdiction to the extent that such are the result of the Indemnified Claim; or (ii) the amounts stated in a written settlement negotiated and approved by Dell. This clause is an exclusive statement of Dell's liability and responsibility for Indemnified Claims and nothing in this Agreement or elsewhere will obligate Dell to provide any greater indemnity. B. Additional Remedies. If Dell receives prompt notice of an Indemnified Claim that, in Dell's reasonable opinion, is likely to result in an adverse ruling, then Dell shall, at its discretion and as a sole and exclusive remedy, offer a reasonable resolution to the breach such as, but not limited to, obtaining a right for you to continue using such Hardware or Services, modifying such Hardware to make it non-infringing or replacing such Hardware. Dell shall have no obligation for any claim resulting or arising from any Excluded Events. C. Process. Dell's duty to indemnify is dependent upon:- (1) Dell receiving prompt written notice of the third party claim; (2) Dell having sole control of the defence and resolution of such claim, and (3) your cooperation with Dell in defending and resolving such claim. D. Indemnity from you. You shall indemnify Dell and its Affiliates against any third party claim arising out of:- (1) your failure to obtain any appropriate license, rights, or other permissions, regulatory certifications or approvals associated with technology, software or data provided by you, or associated with software or components requested by you to be used with, or installed or integrated as part of the Products or Services; (2) your breach of Dell's, its Affiliates' or third parties' intellectual property rights; (3) any inaccurate representation regarding the existence of an export license or any allegation made against Dell or its Affiliates due to your violation or violation of applicable export laws, regulations, or orders; and (4) any allegation made against, or loss to, Dell due to your violation or alleged violation of applicable anti-bribery or anti-corruption laws, regulations or orders. 11. Compliance with Laws A. Each party agrees to comply with all applicable laws and regulations. B. You acknowledge that the Products and Services provided under this Agreement, which may include technology, authentication and encryption, are subject to the customs and export control laws and regulations of the United States ("U.S."); may be rendered or performed either in the U.S., in countries outside the U.S., or outside the borders of the country in which you or your systems are located; and may also be subject to the customs and export laws and regulations of the country in which the Products or Services are rendered or received. You also may be subject to import or re-export restrictions in the event you transfer the Products or Services from the country of delivery and you are responsible for complying with applicable restrictions. 12. Termination A. Either party may terminate this Agreement (i) if the other party commits a material breach which is not cured within 30 days of written notice or (ii) if the other party ceases, or threatens to cease, to carry on business or becomes insolvent. B. Upon termination of this Agreement, all rights and obligations under this Agreement will automatically terminate except for rights of action accruing prior to termination, payment obligations, and any obligations that expressly or by implication are intended to survive termination. Neither Dell nor you exclude or limit liability for (i) death or personal injury resulting from negligence; (ii) fraud or fraudulent misrepresentation; or (iii) any other liability that cannot be excluded by law. B. Neither Dell nor you shall be liable for (i) loss of profit, income or revenue; (ii) loss of use of your systems or networks; (iii) loss of goodwill or reputation; (iv) loss of, corruption of or damage to data, software or media; (v) recovery or reinstallation of data or programs; or (vi) special, indirect or consequential loss or damage. C. Neither party's total liability to the other party, however arising out of or in connection with this Agreement, shall exceed 125% of the prices payable by you to Dell under this Agreement. 14. Data Privacy A. Each party shall comply with all laws and regulations that are applicable to that party in relation to the processing of personal data under this Agreement. In this clause, "personal data", "controller" and "processing" shall have the meaning set out in the General Data B. You shall obtain all necessary rights, permissions and consents prior to disclosing any personal data to Dell. C. To the extent that Dell processes any personal data on your behalf in the performance of this Agreement, Dell shall only process the personal data as required to fulfil its legal obligations under applicable laws and regulations and in accordance with a form of Data Processing Agreement to be agreed between the parties. In the absence of an agreed form of Data Processing Agreement, where and to the extent that Dell is required to process any personal data in the performance of this Agreement (Dell acting as a processor, for you, as a controller of the relevant personal data), it shall do so in accordance with Dell's standard Data Processing terms, available here: http://Ldell.com/sites/doccontent/legal/terms- conditions/en/Documents/Data Protection Terms UK EN.pdf D. You agree that, subject to Dell's compliance with this clause 14, Dell can use any customer or transaction related data for the purposes of providing, assessing and/or improving Products, Services or other offerings. 15. WEEE Compliance Dell takes responsibility for compliance with the Waste Electrical and Electronic Equipment Directive 2002/96/EC ("WEEE") as amended or superseded from time to time. You are responsible for returning products at your cost to Dell's designated collection facilities as per Dell's WEEE recycling program - http://www.euro.dell.com/recycling . 16. Additional Terms A. Assignment and Subcontracting. Neither party may assign or transfer this Agreement without the prior written consent of the other party except that Dell may without your consent (i) assign to its affiliated companies and (ii) subcontract any or all of its obligations under this Agreement but shall remain liable to you for such obligations. B. Excused Performance. Neither party shall be liable to the other for any delay or failure to perform any of its obligations caused by events beyond its reasonable control. If the delay lasts longer than 30 days, then the other party may immediately terminate, in whole or in part, this Agreement by giving written notice to the delayed party. C. Governing Law. This Agreement will be governed by English law and the English courts shall have exclusive jurisdiction. D. Third Party Rights. A person who is not a party to this Agreement shall have no rights under the Contracts (Rights of Third Parties) Act 1999 to enforce any term of this Agreement. E. Notices. Notice to Dell under this Agreement must be in writing and sent by postage prepaid first-class mail or receipted courier service to the address below or to such other address (including e-mail) as specified in writing, and will be effective upon receipt. Dell Corporation Limited, Dell House, The Boulevard, Cain Road, Bracknell, Berkshire RG12 1LF F. Entire Agreement. This Agreement is the entire agreement with respect to its subject matter and each party acknowledges that it has not relied on, and shall have no right or remedy in respect of any statement, representation or warranty other than as expressly set out in this Agreement. G. Changes. Changes to this Agreement will be made only through a written amendment signed by both parties. H. Severability. If any provision of this Agreement is found to be void or unenforceable, such provision will be removed or modified to the extent necessary to give effect to the commercial intention of the parties and to comply with the law, and the remainder of this Agreement will remain in full force. data.text: SERVICES AGREEMENT This Services Agreement (hereinafter called the “Agreement”) is made on , 2020, By and between: Fidelity Information Services India Pvt. Ltd., a Company incorporated under the Companies Act, 1956, having its registered office at S-405(LGF), Greater Kailash Part II, New Delhi-110048, and having its IT/ITES operations at C-5, Sector 126, Noida, Gautam Buddah Nagar, UP 201301 hereinafter referred to as “FISI” which expression shall include its successors and permitted assigns; And Corporate Telesystems Pvt. Ltd., a Company incorporated under the Companies Act, 1956, having its registered place of business located at Y-53, Ist & IInd Floor, Okhla Industrial Area Phase-IINew Delhi- 110020 hereinafter referred to as “Contractor”, which expression shall include its successors and permitted assigns. WHEREAS, FISI desires avail the Maintenance Services for Matrix Epabx system with 4 PRI Lines/480 Analog extensions/ Operator Console/ VoIP Cards/ Voice Mail Card/ Master Cards & Operator console etc. from Contractor; and AND WHEREAS, Contractor is willing to provide such services pursuant to the terms and conditions contained herein. NOW THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual promises and covenants contained herein, the Parties agree as follows: 1. Scope of Contractor’s Services: Contractor shall perform the following Services and create and deliver the following deliverables: 1.1 Contractor will provide onsite support including replacement of faulty parts/ cards during the contracted period. 1.2 During the contracted period any faults occurring on the systems will be rectified free of cost, this however does not include any physical damage, or damage arising out of misuse, tampering, improper handling, poor power conditions, external high voltage, water seepage, rodent menaces, earthquake, lightning etc. 1 initials initials 1.3 Remote support/ Telephonic support will be available from 09.30 AM to 07.00 PM 6 days a week, Onsite services if required will be provided by Contractor within 4-5 hours of receipt of the complaint call. In case if replacement of Hardware is required, Contractor will replace the faulty card/ Parts the same day on which compliant is received. 1.4 Contractor will ensure 99% uptime of installed hardware measured on monthly basis on individual equipment. 1.5 During the contracted period all software upgradations provided by Manufacturer will be offered free of cost. All new features which are added by the manufacturer during this duration will be communicated to FISI team and can be implemented as per their comfort. Any hardware upgradation if offered by manufacturer free of cost, the same will be done at your end without any cost involved. However, if Hardware upgradations are required to achieve compliance requirements and mitigate Vulnerabilities and are charged by manufacturer , the same will be communicated to your team to take necessary commercial approvals to move forward. 1.6 All the complaint calls can be logged on support@ctplindia.in or Contractor team can be contacted at 011-47282828/011-46519600 at first level. If FISI feel that the call is not attended to properly then FISI can always log a complaint at rakesh.grover@ctplindia.in or contact at 9811031488. In case still the problem persists than FISI can always log a call at support@matrixcomsec.com/ prashanta.dutta@matrixcomsec.com and they are contactable at 0265-2630555/9313374302. 1.7 Response Time & Resolution Time (Incident/Problem/Configuration Management Services) Response Time Restoration Time Severity 1 (more than 35% Users Impacted) 15 Min. 2 Hrs Severity 2 (more than 10% Users Impacted) 1 Hr. 4 Hrs. Severity 3 2 Hrs. 24 Hrs. 2. FISI Responsibilities: FIS will log complaint with Contractor and will facilitate them to provide the access of system for support purpose. 3. Term and Termination of Services: 3.1 The Services will commence on 1st January 2020 and shall continue to be provided through 31st December 2022, unless terminated earlier pursuant to this Agreement. The term of this Agreement may be extended by mutual written agreement of the parties hereto. 2 initials initials 3.2 Both Parties agree that FISI shall have the right to terminate this Agreement by giving a 30-day prior written notice to the other Party, without assigning any reason thereof. 3.3 This Agreement may be immediately terminated by either Party in the event that the other Party (i) makes an assignment for the benefit of its creditors, (ii) goes into liquidation, (iii) has a receiver or trustee appointed for its property, (iv) has proceedings for voluntary bankruptcy instituted on its behalf (v) has proceedings for involuntary bankruptcy instituted against it that are not dismissed within 30 days or (vi) is declared bankrupt or insolvent by a court of competent jurisdiction. 4. Location of Services & Billing Address: The services will be performed at the following FISI location:- Fidelity Information Services India Pvt. Ltd. C-5, Sector 126, Noida, Gautam Buddah Nagar, UP 201301 5. Fees: 5.1 In consideration of the services provided hereunder, FISI shall pay to Contractor as fees/charges for the services provided by Contractor in the following manner: AJAY RAMCHAND RA KAN SARA Digitally signed by AJAY RAMCHANDRA KANSARA Date: 2020.06.24 12:50:08 +05'30' Date of Payment (Milestone Events) Amount of Fee INR 1st Quarter 1st January’2020 To 31st March’2020 27,504 2nd Quarter 1st April’2020 To 30th June’2020 27,504 3rd Quarter 1st July’2020 To 30th September’2020 27,504 4th Quarter 1st October’2020 To 31st December’2020 27,504   1st Quarter 1st January’2021 To 31st March’2021 27,504 2nd Quarter 1st April’2021 To 30th June’2021 27,504 3rd Quarter 1st July’2021 To 30th September’2021 27,504 4th Quarter 1st October’2021 To 31st December’2021 27,504    1st Quarter 1st January’2022 To 31st March’2022 27,504 2nd Quarter 1st April’2022 To 30th June’2022 27,504 3rd Quarter 1st July’2022 To 30th September’2022 27,504 4th Quarter 1st October’2022 To 31st December’2022 27,504  Total 330,048 5.2 5.3 Services Fee/Price/Charges/Consideration payable to Contractor under this Agreement will be exclusive of Goods and Service Tax (GST) as may be applicable at the time of issuance of Invoice and the same will be billed separately. For the purposes of this Agreement, the term GST shall include the Central Goods and Service Tax (CGST), the State Goods and Service Tax (SGST), Union Territory Goods and Service Tax (UTGST), Integrated Goods and Service Tax (IGST) and any other taxes levied under the GST or other indirect tax related legislation in India as may be applicable. The term GST legislation/s should be accordingly interpreted. Contractor undertake to do necessary compliance including timely issuance of Invoice or any other document, uploading the relevant entries on the GSTN and making payments of GST, cesses, 3 initials initials interest, penalties or any other tax/duty/amount/charge or other statutory liabilities arising either out of applicable laws/regulations or because of a demand/recovery initialed by any Revenue or other Statutory Authorities under applicable laws/regulations. 5.4 Contractor shall inform on a timely basis the compliance rating that is being assigned to it. The manner and periodicity for communicating such ratings can be mutually agreed with the Contractor, however the same shall not be less than once in a year. 5.5 Contractor agrees that it will be solely responsible for performing all compliance including correct classification and making payments of GST, cesses, interest, penalties or any other tax/duty/amount/charges or other statutory liabilities arising either out of applicable laws/regulations. 5.6 In case any GST and /or cess liability, interest, penalties or other tax/duty/amount/charge/other statutory liabilities/professional costs becomes payable by FISI or input credit is denied to FISI due to failure of the Contractor to comply with the applicable laws/regulations, the Contractor undertakes to indemnify FISI for an amount equal to amount payable/foregone by FISI. 5.7 FISI reserves the right to adjust any recovery to be made by it for losses suffered due to failure on part of the Contractor by adjusting it or withholding it from any amount deposited with FISI any other amount payable by FISI to Contractor (present or future). In case the Contractor get blacklisted, FISI shall be entitled to recover amounts equivalent to the input tax credit denied (including applicable interest and penalty) and tax (if any) on such recoveries. 6 Expenses: FISI will not reimburse Contractor for expenses incurred. 7 Payment Terms and Conditions: 7.1 FISI shall pay the amounts payable to Contractor hereunder within thirty (30) calendar days after FISI’ receipt of a correct invoice submitted by Contractor along with all supporting documents issued in compliance with applicable tax laws (including Goods and Service Tax laws). Should FISI dispute in good faith all or any portion of the amount due or require any adjustment to the fees, FISI may withhold payment of the disputed amount but shall notify Contractor in writing of the nature and basis of the dispute and/or adjustment as soon as possible. If FISI’ dispute is with regard to a portion of an invoice, the undisputed portion shall be paid as provided herein. Each party shall use its commercially- reasonable and good faith efforts to resolve the dispute prior to the payment due date. 7.2 All payments under this Agreement shall be subject to deduction of applicable withholding taxes under Direct Tax laws and under Indirect Tax laws if prescribed by GST legislation. 8 Invoice Submission Address: Contractor shall send all invoices to the following address: FIS Global Business Solutions India Private Limited I-Park, Plot No. 15, Udyog Vihar Phase - 4, Gurgaon, Haryana-122016 4 initials initials Attention: Bill desk 9 Confidentiality and Proprietary Rights: 9.1 In the course of performing its obligations under this Agreement, either Party may disclose to the other information concerning its computer software, inventions, confidential know-how, copyrights, future plans, procedures, customer lists, and other trade secrets and proprietary information (collectively, "Confidential Information"). All such Confidential Information shall remain the sole property of the disclosing Party, shall be used by the recipient solely for purposes of its performance pursuant to this Agreement and shall be disclosed only to the recipient's employees with a need to know for purposes of such performance. The recipient of Confidential Information shall have no interest in or rights with respect thereto, except as expressly set forth in this Agreement. 9.2 The Parties agree to take all reasonable precautions to prevent the unauthorized disclosure of such Confidential Information, which shall in no event be less than the precautions taken by each Party with respect to its own Confidential Information. The foregoing restrictions on use and disclosure shall survive the termination, expiration, or cancellation of this Agreement, but shall not apply to any information which: (1) is in the public domain as of the date of receipt by recipient; (2) hereafter becomes known to the public through no fault of recipient; (3) is actually and demonstrably in the possession of recipient from sources other than the disclosing Party at the time of the disclosure; (4) is subsequently obtained by recipient in good faith from an independent, third party source having no obligation of confidentiality, directly or indirectly, to the relevant Party; (5) is required by law to be disclosed, in which case the recipient shall immediately notify the disclosing Party and cooperate in efforts to limit or avoid disclosure, if requested by the disclosing Party; or (6) is disclosed in connection with a Party’s reporting and disclosure requirements under applicable securities laws. 9.3 If an employee of either Party or someone working under its direction makes an unauthorized disclosure of Confidential Information, then that Party shall cooperate fully in the other's enforcement of its legal and contractual rights. In addition, the Party making unauthorized disclosure shall use its best efforts to assist the other Party in mitigating damage caused to such other Party by the disclosure. 9.4 Each Party acknowledges that any breach of its obligations by it under this Section 9 would cause the other Party irreparable injury for which it would not have an adequate remedy at law. In the event of a breach, the non-breaching Party shall be entitled to injunctive relief in addition to any other remedies it may have at law or in equity. 10 Warranties: 10.1 Contractor represents and warrants that (i) the Services will be performed in a timely, professional and workmanlike manner, in accordance with the Parties’ mutually agreed upon written standards or guidelines, and (ii) the delivered items shall substantially conform to the specifications applicable thereto, as set forth in this Agreement. 10.2 Contractor represents and warrants to FISI that all Services will be performed by its personnel who are fully trained and qualified and that such personnel will use their commercially reasonable best efforts to perform the Services at a level consistent with persons having similar education, experience and expertise relevant to IT Industry. 5 initials initials 10.3 Contractor hereby represents and warrants that it has full right and authority to perform its obligations and grant the rights herein granted, and that it has neither assigned nor otherwise entered into any agreement which purports to assign or transfer any right or title to or interest in any technology or intellectual property right that would conflict with its obligations under this Agreement. Contractor covenants and agrees that it shall not enter into any such agreement. 10.4 For any services provided by Contractor on behalf of FISI prior to the execution of this Agreement that are not covered by any other agreement, Contractor hereby (i) agrees that the terms and conditions of this Agreement cover those prior services, and (ii) represents, warrants and agrees that Contractor has performed or will perform all of its respective obligations and comply with all of its respective covenants required for such services. 10.5 Contractor represents and warrants that all information it provides to FISI as part of the Services, is true and accurate and complete to the best of Contractor’s knowledge, and that no such information is knowingly false or misleading or with material omission. Contractor further represents and warrants that it has exercised and shall exercise due diligence and care in ensuring that all such information it provides to FISI is true and accurate and complete. 11 Limitation of liabilities: 11.1 No Party excludes or limits its liability to the other Party for death or personal injury that arises from its negligence, or claims or causes of action arising out of its fraud, or that of its employees, agents or subcontractors. 11.2 The indemnities given under Section 12 of this Agreement shall not be limited in amount. 11.3 Neither Party shall be liable to the other for (i) loss of profits, business, revenue, goodwill or anticipated savings, and/or (ii) for indirect or consequential loss or damage in connection with or arising out of this Agreement. 11.4 Subject to Sections 11.1, 11.2 and 11.3, the liability of either Party to the other Party for any claim or cause of action, whether arising under, or related to this Agreement, whether from negligence, misrepresentation, breach of contract or otherwise, shall not exceed and shall be limited to such other Party’s direct damages, actually incurred, which under no circumstances shall exceed the amount of fees payable by FISI to Contractor under this Agreement during the period of 12 months immediately preceding the date the claim or cause of action arose, in respect of all claims and/or causes of action during the term of this Agreement. 12 Indemnification: 12.1 Contractor will defend, indemnify and hold harmless FISI, its current and former officers, directors, partners, employees and agents from any and all third-party claims or actions, expenses (including reasonable attorneys’ fees, which may include the allocable cost of in-house counsel), damages, suits, costs, losses or judgments whatsoever, arising out of or relating to: (i) bodily injuries (including death, no matter when death occurs) or damages to real or tangible property that are caused by, arise out of, are connected with or result from the negligence or willful misconduct of Contractor or of such Party’s personnel in connection with the performance of the Services by Contractor hereunder; and 6 initials initials (ii) any proprietary information developed or supplied by Contractor that infringes on, violates or misappropriates any copyright, patent, trademark, trade secret or other proprietary right, or involves libel, slander, defamation, violation of personal rights of privacy, misappropriation of ideas or rights, literary piracy or plagiarism. 12.2 Contractor will defend, indemnify and hold harmless FISI, its current and former officers, directors, employees and agents from any and all claims or actions, expenses (including reasonable attorney’s fees), damages, suits, costs, losses or judgments whatsoever, arising out of or relating to, in whole or in part, Contractor’s acts or omissions under this Agreement. 13 Entire Agreement and Amendments: This Agreement contains the sole and entire agreement and understanding of the Parties with respect to the entire subject matter hereof, and any and all prior and concurrent discussions, negotiations, commitments, understandings and agreements relating thereto are superseded hereby. Any special provisions mutually agreed to by the Parties that reference this Agreement and that are attached to this Agreement are incorporated into this Agreement as though set forth at length herein, and in the event of any conflict between the terms of this Agreement and any such special provision, the terms of the special provision will prevail. This Agreement may not be modified or amended except by a writing signed by the Parties hereto. 14 Independent Contractor Relationship: It is the Parties’ intention that Contractor and its personnel be independent contractors under this Agreement. This Agreement will not be construed as a partnership or joint venture between the Parties and neither Party will be liable for any obligations incurred by the other Party, including but not limited to any contract or agreement of employment. Except upon the prior written consent of FISI, Contractor will have no authority to bind or commit FISI in any manner. Contractor will not represent to any person that it is an agent, officer, or employee of FISI or, except as provided in the preceding sentence, that it is otherwise authorized to bind FISI to any transaction. 15 Assignment: Without the prior written consent of FISI, Contractor may not sell, assign, transfer, by operation of law or otherwise, or encumber its rights under this Agreement, nor delegate its obligations hereunder. 16 Severability: If any term or provision of this Agreement is found by a court of competent jurisdiction to be invalid, illegal or otherwise unenforceable, the same shall not affect the other terms or provisions hereof or the whole of this Agreement, but such term or provision shall be deemed modified to the extent necessary to the court’s opinion to render such term or provision enforceable, and the rights and obligations of the Parties shall be construed and enforced accordingly, preserving to the fullest permissible extent the intent and agreements of the Parties herein set forth. 7 initials initials 17 Waiver: No waiver of any provision of this Agreement shall be effective unless it is in writing and signed by the Party against whom it is sought to be enforced. The delay or failure by either Party to exercise or enforce any of its rights under this Agreement shall not constitute or be deemed a waiver of that Party’s right thereafter to enforce those rights, nor shall any single or partial exercise of any such right preclude any other or further exercise thereof or the exercise of any other right. 18 Illegal Activities: With respect to this Agreement, Contractor covenants and agrees that neither Contractor nor any of its directors, officers, agents, employees or other persons associated with or acting on behalf of Contractor has made, will make, has given, or will give any payments or inducements, directly or indirectly, to any government officials in the jurisdictions in which Contractor conducts business in connection with any opportunity, agreement, license, permit, certificate, consent, order, approval, registration, waiver or other authorization relating to the business of Contractor. With respect to this Agreement, Contractor covenants and agrees that neither Contractor nor any of its directors, officers, agents, employees or other persons associated with or acting on behalf of Contractor: (a) has used, or shall use any corporate funds for any unlawful contribution, gift, entertainment or other unlawful expense relating to political activity; (b) has made, or will make any direct or indirect unlawful payment to any government official or employee from corporate funds; or (c) has made, or will make any bribe, unlawful rebate, pay off, influence payment, kickback or other unlawful payment in connection with the business of Contractor. With respect to this Agreement, Contractor covenants and agrees that neither Contractor nor any of its directors, officers, agents, employees or other persons associated with or acting on behalf of Contractor has violated, is in violation of, or will violate the U.S. Foreign Corrupt Practices Act of 1977, U.K. Bribery Act and any amendments thereto. Contractor covenants and agrees that the foreign governments or public international organizations, or instrumentalities of these entities, which are the subject of its representation hereunder, are and shall be the ultimate customers or beneficiaries of any FISI services resulting from such representation. Contractor additionally covenants and agrees that it shall not retain any sub-agent, sub-contractor, or representative without the prior written consent of a senior executive officer of FISI. Contractor further warrants and covenants that it will cause its relevant personnel to submit to a reasonable level of remote access anti-bribery and anticorruption training at FISI’ request. Such training will be provided at FISI’s cost but Contractor will not charge FISI for the time required to undertake the training. Contractor understands, acknowledges and agrees that FISI shall have an irrevocable right to immediately terminate this Agreement as a result of any breach by Contractor of any such undertakings, representations, and agreements set forth herein. 19 Subcontractors: Only Contractor will perform the services provided pursuant to this Agreement. Subcontractors, independent contractors, consultants and any other third parties may not be used by Contractor without FISI’s prior written consent. 20 Third Party Beneficiaries: The provisions of this Agreement are for the benefit of the Parties and not for any other persons or entities. Should any third-party institute proceedings, this Agreement shall not provide any such party with any remedy, claim, liability, reimbursement, cause of action, or other right. 8 initials initials 21 Construction: The headings and numbering of sections in this Agreement are for convenience only and shall not be construed to define or limit any of the terms or affect the scope, meaning or interpretation of this Agreement or the particular section to which they relate. This Agreement and the provisions contained herein shall not be construed or interpreted for or against any Party because that Party drafted or caused its legal representative to draft any of its provisions. 22 Remedies Cumulative: Unless otherwise provided for under this Agreement, all rights of termination or cancellation, or other remedies set forth in this Agreement, are cumulative and are not intended to be exclusive of other remedies to which the injured Party may be entitled by law or equity in case of any breach or threatened breach by the other Party of any provision in this Agreement. Use of one or more remedies shall not bar use of any other remedy for the purpose of enforcing any provision of this Agreement. 23 Audit: Contractor shall keep complete, accurate, and up-to-date books and records in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles and sound business practices covering all transactions relating to this Agreement. Auditors acting on behalf of FISI, or FISI’s auditors, shall upon reasonable notice have the right, but not the obligation, to inspect such records and facilities in order to determine whether all provisions of this Agreement have been met, subject to Contractor’s confidentiality obligations to Contractor’s clients. Notwithstanding the foregoing, such confidentiality provisions with Contractor’s clients shall not prevent FISI from obtaining information as to Contractor’s compliance with law in respect to its activities hereunder. The Parties agree that all information and records obtained in such audit shall be considered Confidential Information under the Agreement. This right to audit shall be available to FISI for up to 6 months following the termination of this Agreement. In the event that any such audit indicates either (i) Contractor’s nonconformity to the requirements of law, or (ii) a disparity between the requirements of this Agreement and Contractor’s actual performance, in addition to any additional rights or remedies that FISI can assert, Contractor shall reimburse FISI for all penalties and/or fines imposed upon FISI arising out of Contractor’s non-compliance with law. 24 Background check. As a condition of engagement, Contractor shall ensure that each Contractor’s personnel to provide services under this Agreement shall, at Contractor’s expense, been subjected to such background checks as are reasonably required by FISI and that FISI has reviewed the findings of such checks and is satisfied with the results. In the event that a proposed Contractor’s personnel do not meet FISI’s standards with respect to such background checks, FISI shall be entitled to terminate this Agreement with immediate effect and without incurring any liabilities to Contractor. The afore-mentioned background check shall include but is not limited to background check within the 12-month period immediately preceding the engagement for the Services, for any criminal records, employment history, education credentials and previous addresses. 25. Insurance. Contractor shall bear the cost of, and be solely responsible for, obtaining and maintaining full insurance coverage for each of such Contractor’s personnel, including, without limitation, workers’ compensation, full and partial disability and comprehensive commercial general liability, and any other 9 initials initials insurance to which FISI may be entitled or which FIS may reasonably request. Contractor shall make FISI an additional insured on any such policy or policies (other than workers’ compensation, full or partial disability or professional liability). Within five (5) business days after the Effective Date and each time the insurance coverage is renewed during the term of this Agreement, Contractor shall furnish to FIS a certificate of insurance. 26 Dispute Resolution: If any dispute(s), claim(s), reference(s), or difference(s) arising out of or touching any clause, matter or concerning anything whatsoever, herein contained or the operation or construction thereof, or any matter or thing in any way connected with the rights, duties, or liabilities of either party under or in connection with this Agreement, then the same shall be referred to a sole arbitrator to be appointed by the mutual consent of both parties; and in case no agreement is reached between the parties on the appointment of a sole arbitrator, then to a panel of three arbitrators, one each to be nominated by each party, and the third arbitrator, who shall be the Presiding Arbitrator, to be appointed by the two arbitrators so nominated by the respective parties, as aforesaid. The award passed by the said Arbitral Tribunal shall be final and binding on the parties. The proceedings shall be conducted/ governed by the provisions of the Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996. The place of arbitration proceedings shall be New Delhi. 27 Governing Laws: This Agreement is governed by the laws of the republic of India, without giving effect to the conflict of law rules thereof. All judicial proceedings shall be litigated, if at all, exclusively in the courts of New Delhi and, if necessary, the corresponding appellate courts. Each party agrees not to bring any action or proceeding arising out of or relating to such judicial proceeding in any other court. Each party waives any defense of inconvenient forum to the maintenance of any action or proceeding so brought and waives any bond, surety or to the other security that might be required of any party with respect thereto. Nothing in this Section, however, shall affect the right of any party to serve legal process in any other manner permitted by law or in equity. Each party agrees that a final judgment in any action or proceeding so brought shall be conclusive and may be enforced by suit on the judgment or in any other manner provided by law or in equity. IN WITNESS WHEREOF, this Agreement has been executed by the undersigned duly authorized representatives of the Parties as of the date indicated hereinabove. Fidelity Information Services India Pvt.
